learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the common health and management problems encountered in horses, cattle, small ruminants, pigs and camelids and be able to describe the management or treatment options for these problems.

Demonstrate knowledge and competence in the skills and procedures involved in the diagnosis and management of large animal species health problems including safely performing physical examinations, diagnostic procedures, and medication techniques of those species.

Demonstrate knowledge of the execution of a post-mortem examination in large animal species, understand the zoonotic potential of some large animal diseases and be able to apply the principles of infection control and biosecurity to prevent zoonoses.
Demonstrate the ability to identify parasites of importance in large animals and be able to describe their control and successful management when identified.

assessments.assessment_title: Assessment sequence - Practical and Tutorial Quizzes
assessments.task_description:
The quizzes will be held at the end of the practical and tutorial sessions.

  • Sheep handling and clinical examination (practical) - 4 questions
  • Equine handling (practical) - 4 questions
  • Equine clinical examination (practical) - 4 questions
  • Cattle clinical examination (practical) - 4 questions
  • Cattle procedures (practical) - 4 questions
  • Equine dentistry & radiology (tutorial) - 3 questions each tutorial
  • Equine procedures and bandaging (practical) - 4 questions

These quizzes are to be submitted by the end of the practical or tutorial to the corresponding instructor.

Each question is worth 1 mark to a total of 30 marks across the listed activities and this will contribute 30% towards the final mark for VETS3018.

Anyone not attending a practical will not be eligible for the quiz marks from that particular practical or tutorial class.

The results will be posted on Grade Centre.

NOTE: There is no quiz associated with the needle and syringe skills tutorial.
assessments.submission_guidelines: These quizzes are to be submitted at the end of the practical or tutorial to the corresponding instructor.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This exam is an on-campus invigilated practical and theory examination with a duration of 2hrs with 1hr for each section. This time does not include moving between practical and theory components of the exam that will occur in different rooms/labs and under differing examination conditions. Details of the exam components, exam conditions for both theory and practical will be provided during the semester.

This exam accounts for a total of 20% towards the final mark for VETS3018.

This exam is based on all parasitology lectures (large animal parasitology 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6) and the parasitology practical and examines different aspects of large animal parasitological knowledge. The student is expected to be able to identify parasites of importance in large animal veterinary practice and be able to describe their control and management.

The results will be posted on Grade Centre.

NOTE: The content from the parasitology lectures and practical will not be re-examined specifically in the final exam but a general knowledge of parasitology is expected as some health and management conditions in large animals will have parasites as possible differential diagnoses or a possible instigating cause. Consequently, some parasitological knowledge would be assumed for the final examination.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Examination paper for each section is to submitted at the end of each examination component.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The end of semester Final Exam will be an in-person invigilated digital Inspera exam and students will complete this exam using their own laptop. 

Technical support and laptops to borrow if needed are provided through UQ Library Services and AskUs.

The Final Exam will be held following the lecture series, and consists of multiple-choice questions (MCQ), short answer and essay-type questions on the material presented throughout the course in lectures and practicals, excluding materials from large animal parasitology specifically.

NOTE: The content from the parasitology lectures and practical will not be re-examined specifically in the final exam but a good general knowledge of parasitology is expected as some heath and management conditions in large animals will have parasites as possible differential diagnoses or a possible instigating cause. Consequently, some parasitological knowledge would be assumed for the final examination.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Procedural skills tutorials

These hands-on tutorials (3) aim to increase the skills of the students and add to lecture content.

  • Blood draw - tutorial designed to give students comfort in the use of needles and syringes and the positioning of both body and hands on large animal models before the skills are used on live animals
  • Equine radiology - tutorial using models to examine positioning and angles in the taking of radiographs in a field setting.
  • Equine dentistry - tutorial using models to examine positioning, common pathologies and remedial treatment of equine dental problems.


NOTE - Entry to the clinical skills HUB requires closed shoes and either laboratory coats, scrubs or clean clothing depending on the tutorial. Students will be advised on appropriate clothing during the course.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Lectures will be delivered that cover a range of topics in large animal medicine, surgery and management.

These can be grouped generally into modules that will include

  • clinical examination and procedural skills in horses cattle and small ruminants
  • large animal clinical parasitology
  • reproductive management, obstetrics and neonatal care in horses, cattle and small ruminants
  • metabolic and other common disease problems of small and large ruminants
  • equine dentistry and radiology
  • common disease problems in horses

These can be grouped generally into modules that will include clinical examination and procedural skills in horses cattle and small ruminants large animal clinical parasitology reproductive management, obstetrics and neonatal care in horses, cattle and small ruminants metabolic and other common disease problems of small and large ruminants equine dentistry and radiology common disease problems in horses

learning_activities.topic:
Live animal practicals

Practicals in this course aim to increase the clinical and procedural skills in students across a range of species. There is a focus on safety within each practical to ensure confidence across species. The practicals are listed below:

  • Cattle handling and clinical examination
  • Cattle procedural skills
  • Equine handling
  • Equine clinical examination and procedural skills
  • Equine procedural skills and bandaging
  • Sheep handling and clinical skills


NOTE: Entry to practicals without appropriate PPE (i,e, coveralls, appropriate protective boots) will not occur. Sun protection (i.e. hat and SPF50 sunscreen) and water is highly recommended as these practicals will occur during the heat of the Queensland summer.
